Description: Book of the Dead of Padinefertem on linen; row of Black line vignettes at top; Hieratic text below.
Bibliographic references: Quirke 1993 / Owners of funerary papyri in the British Museum (179)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Textile: rolled Black ink Backed: brown paper Mount Details: Box: tin (unsuitable) Object Priority: B Mount Priority: D Overall Condition: C Curatorial condition comment: good
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Louis, Duc de Blacas d'Aulps
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Louis, Duc de Blacas d'Aulps
Acquisition notes: According to Quirke, S. 1993. Owners of Funerary Papyri in the BM, 6, EA 10187 was probably discovered by Passalacqua before 1826, on a mummy found at 'Memphis' (Passalacqua, Catalogue raisonné et historique des antiquités découvertes en Egypte (Paris, 1826), 142, n.1)) and then passed to the Duc de Blacas d'Aulps (1771-1839), supporter of Champollion. His son Louis continued to expand the collection up to its sale in 1866 to the British Museum.
